content.raw: Ok so connections is such a pain because all numpy arrays have byte strings as type but we need unicode strings in the most places(module names etc.). As we want old files to still work and since hdf5 [doesn't support numpys unicode](http://docs.h5py.org/en/latest/strings.html#exceptions-for-python-3) dtype we will need to add lots of decoding in connections.py I guess
content.html: Ok so connections is such a pain because all numpy arrays have byte strings as type but we need unicode strings in the most places(module names etc.). As we want old files to still work and since hdf5 doesn't support numpys unicode dtype we will need to add lots of decoding in connections.py I guess
